postal_code_type = [[List of postal codes in Spain|Postal code]] | postal_code = 28940-28947 | area_code_type = [[Telephone numbers in Spain|Dialing code]] | area_code = | leader_title = [[Mayor]] | leader_name = {{ill|Javier Ayala|es}} | leader_party = [[Spanish Socialist Workers' Party|PSOE]] | website = [http://www.ayto-fuenlabrada.es/ www.ayto-fuenlabrada.es] | footnotes = }} '''Fuenlabrada''' ({{IPA-es|fwenlaˈβɾaða}}) is a city and municipality in the [[Community of Madrid]], [[Spain]]. It is to the south of the region, 22.5 km from the [[Madrid]]. {{As of|2018}}, it has a population of 193,586, making it the region's fourth most populated municipality.
== Placename == The name probably has its origin in ''Fuente Labrada'' (Spanish for "carved fountain").
== History == The first information about Fuenlabrada was recorded 200 years after its founding because of an ambitious project promoted by [[Philip II of Spain]], the [[Topographic Relations of Philip II]]. All the cities, towns and villages received a royal order by which they were obliged to answer an extensive questionnaire about everything related to history, geography, economics, demography, customs... It is all about the historic-geographic relations of all the villages of [[Spain]]. With the many pieces of information gathered by that questionnaire an accurate report of Fuenlabrada was created in the 16th century.
== Transport == === Roads === The city is linked with the [[Autopista de Circunvalación M-50|M-50]], [[Autovía A-42|A-42]], M-506, M-407 and M-409 highways. It is connected as well to the neighbouring towns of [[Humanes de Madrid]] and [[Moraleja de Enmedio]] through the M-413 and M-405 local roads, respectively.
=== Metro === [[File:Fuenlabrada Central.jpg|thumb|upright=0.7|Fuenlabrada [[Cercanías Madrid|Central Railway]] (and [[Madrid Metro|Metro]]) Station.]] Fuenlabrada has good transport connections with [[Madrid]], [[Móstoles]], [[Getafe]], [[Alcorcón]] and [[Leganés]] through the [[Madrid Metro]] line [[Line 12 (Madrid Metro)|12]] (also known as Metrosur -South Metro Network-), including five stations: * [[Loranca (Madrid Metro)|Loranca]]. * [[Hospital de Fuenlabrada (Madrid Metro)|Hospital de Fuenlabrada]]. * [[Parque Europa (Madrid Metro)|Parque Europa]]. * [[Fuenlabrada Central (Madrid Metro)|Fuenlabrada Central]] (transfer with Fuenlabrada Cercanías station). * [[Parque de los Estados (Madrid Metro)|Parque de los Estados]].
=== Commuter train === Fuenlabrada is connected to Madrid via the [[Cercanías Madrid]] line C-5, a [[commuter train]] service, having two stations: * Fuenlabrada (Transfer with Fuenlabrada Central metro station). * La Serna.
== Demography == Fuenlabrada witnessed a dramatic population explosion in the 1980s, due to large scale immigration of young workers coming from the capital city and other agrarian regions (chiefly [[Extremadura]], [[Castilla-La Mancha]], [[Andalusia]] and [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]) seeking affordable prices in housing. By 1975, the municipality had already reached a population of 18,442. Foreign workers have also settled in the city, most of them coming from Latin America, Africa, the Maghreb, China and Romania.
==Education== [[File:Facultad de Ciencias Jurídicas y Sociales (URJC).JPG|thumb|right|upright=0.7|URJC Faculty of Law and Social Sciences]] === Primary and Secondary education === Fuenlabrada has 33 [[kindergarten]] and daycare centers, 50 [[primary schools]] and 15 [[secondary schools]] And a particularly recommended English Language school Called Anglo Language services.
=== Higher education === The [[Universidad Rey Juan Carlos]] (URJC) has a secondary campus in the city, housing the faculties of [[communication sciences]], [[telecommunications]] engineering, [[tourism]], [[business administration]], among other courses.
The [[National University of Distance Education]] (UNED) also has a branch here.
==Sports== [[File:Polideportivo Fernando Martín, Fuenlabrada.jpg|thumb|upright=0.7|[[Polideportivo Fernando Martín]]]] The city is home to basketball team [[Baloncesto Fuenlabrada]], currently playing in the first tier division ([[Liga ACB]]), having competed in the top flight division of Spanish basketball for several years. Their home games are played at [[Polideportivo Fernando Martín|Fernando Martín]] sports centre, which has a capacity of 5,700.
[[CF Fuenlabrada]] is the local football team, playing in Segunda División (second tier in Spanish league). They play as home team at the {{ill|Fernando Torres stadium|es|Estadio Fernando Torres}}, inaugurated by the footballer's parents on September 1, 2011. The stadium has a capacity of 7,500.
== Twin towns and sister cities == * [[San Juan del Río Coco]], Nicaragua (since 1988)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.radiolaprimerisima.com/noticias/general/53423/alcaldes-nicas-espana-conocen-de-proyectos-medioambiente/|work=Radiolaprimerisima|title=Alcaldes nicas España conocen de proyectos medioambiente|date=21 May 2009}}</ref> * [[Joal-Fadiouth]], Senegal (since 1999)<ref>{{Cite journal|journal=La Nueva Crónica|url=https://www.lanuevacronica.com/camino-al-corazon-y-al-color-de-africa|title=Camino al corazón y al color de África|first=Mar|last=Iglesias|date=3 December 2017}}</ref>
==Notable people== * [[Fernando Torres]], born in Fuenlabrada on March 20, 1984 * [[Roberto Jimenez Gago|Roberto]], born in Fuenlabrada on February 10, 1986
